location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 140: Captain Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to Commodore John Patterson Porter, Commander of the Indian Naval Squadron in the Persian Gulf, Bushire

mods.abstract: This letter concerns Commodore John Patterson Porter's forthcoming cruise to the Arabian coast. Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Acting Resident at Bushire, informs Porter that he has obtained from Meerza Mahmood Khan the deputation of one of his subordinates to proceed on board the Honourable Company's sloop Clive, in case Porter wishes to search any vessels carrying the Persian flag which he suspects of being engaged in the slave trade.
